title: Senior Backend Software Engineer (Ruby)
description:
What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company, achieving consistent double-digit growth by steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development — as well as unlimited growth opportunities. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.

About Gartner Digital Markets: Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology decisions and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three leading brands—Capterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.

What we are looking for: GetApp is looking for a passionate Senior Backend Software Engineer to work with our highly skilled technology team located in central Barcelona.

This position will make an impact on the design of backend architecture for our applications, whilst working closely with our designers and engineers to build a compelling product and implement exciting new features - all with the goal of ensuring a great experience for website users.

Why you will want to come to the office everyday: Your primary responsibility will be development and maintenance of the backend part of the GetApp website codebase ensuring the highest quality experience for our users.

Responsible for the timely development of well-defined, larger product features/changes, expected to use judgement & apply functional knowledge of methodology/best practices; Develop code documentation as a reference.

Become active participant in technical design process, expected to contribute own ideas for changes/new features; Capable of owning independent small-to-medium features all the way through from technical design to launch.

Improves operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures.

Challenging projects: You will work on the main website, recommendation systems, chatbot and many other.

Web technologies: Ruby is our language of choice, the stack is composed of MySQL, Solr, Redis, AWS (including Personalize), Google Cloud Services and others. We actively use Docker to power our infrastructure.

What you will bring to the team: A passion for technology and development, a hunger to learn, a desire to meet challenges, a commitment to applying engineering best practice to produce top quality solutions.

4 years+ experience in Ruby.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering.

Knowledge of software development methodology, techniques & standards.

Understanding of software design concepts, patterns, tools, best practices.

Knowledge of web frameworks (like Sinatra/Rails), testing frameworks (like Rspec/Minitest) and Javascript.

MySQL and Apache Solr is a plus.

Verbal English skills (we work in English!)

What we offer: Limitless growth and learning opportunities.

A collaborative and positive culture — join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you.

A chance to make an impact — Your work will contribute directly to our strategy.

Frequent social activities such as laser tag, bowling, escape room, summer beach party, hiking & bbq, and more!

Modern approach to work - Flexible hours, Friday afternoons free, remote work, and more.

Office close to the beach in the fantastic, “innovation and tech” @22 district of sunny Barcelona.

Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas and fair trade organic coffee.

Relocation Assistance - A specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork.

What you will get: Competitive compensation.

23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December.

Private Medical and Dental Care.

Life and Disability Insurance.

Public Transport Subsidy.

Ticket Restaurant Card.

Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia).

IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities.

Pension Scheme.

Tuition Reimbursement.

Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

Employee Assistance Program.

Gartner Gives Charity Match.

Who we are: Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen.

Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. We’re humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development.

Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually.

#digitalmarkets

PLEASE NOTE:

  • Applications must be submitted in English.

  • A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy

title: Abteilungsleiter (m/w/d) Anwendungsmanagement ERP/SAP
description:
Gestalten Sie mit uns eine der größten und komplexesten IT-Landschaften Deutschlands und unterstützen Sie unser Team als

Abteilungsleiter (m/w/d) Anwendungsmanagement ERP/SAP

ab sofort und in Vollzeit in Bonn.

Als IT-Partner der Bundeswehr und IT-Dienstleistungszentrum des Bundes bieten wir umfassende IT-Services aus einer Hand. Mit über 4.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern zählen wir zu den zehn größten IT-Service-Providern Deutschlands. Wir suchen authentische IT-Liebhaberinnen und IT-Liebhaber, die ihre Leidenschaft mit uns teilen wollen, auf der Suche nach anspruchsvollen IT-Herausforderungen sind und Deutschlands IT gestalten möchten.

Die Business Unit (BU) ERP ist der verlässliche sowie leistungsstarke Partner für alle Phasen von ERP Projekten – im Schwerpunkt SAP – insbesondere für die Abteilung G des Bundesamtes für Ausrüstung, Informationstechnik und Nutzung der Bundeswehr (BAAINBw) und zukünftig für die Behörden des Bundes. Die BU ERP Anwendungsmanagement umfasst das Application Management über den gesamten Produktlebenszyklus. Der Bereich treibt Innovationen zur SAP- und Non-SAP-Landschaft des Kunden verantwortlich voran. Aufgrund der hohen Verzahnung erfolgt eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Digitalisierungsprogrammen, der BU Bw sowie der Shared Service Delivery. Standardisierung, Re-Engineering und Automatisierung sind dabei wichtige Rahmenparameter.

Erfahren Sie mehr in unserem Portfolio.

Ihre Aufgaben:

  • Fachliche und disziplinarische Führung eines elfköpfigen Teams
  • Sicherstellung einer qualitativ hochwertigen Vertragserfüllung durch störungsfreien SLA-konformen Applikationsbetrieb für das verantwortete Portfolio Legacy-Systeme und SAP
  • Aktives Vorantreiben des Zukunftsprojektes SAP@Cloud im Rahmen des verantworteten Portfolios
  • Verantwortliche Umsetzung und Betrieb von standardisierten Lösungen im Rahmen der verantworteten Verfahren gemäß den Kundenanforderungen unter Einbindung externer Partner
  • Intensive Kundenkommunikation und Gremienvertretung
  • Sicherstellung der fachlichen und prozessualen Abstimmung innerhalb der BWI in allen Fragen der Leistungserbringung des verantworteten Portfolios
  • Personalverantwortliche Entwicklung und Förderung der MitarbeiterInnen sowie aktives Umsetzen der Unternehmensstrategien und Werte der BWI
  • Sicherstellung des Skill-Aufbaus und Bereitstellung der für den Anwendungsbetrieb erforderlichen Ressourcen

Ihr Profil:

  • Abgeschlossenes IT-bezogenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik bzw. Nachweise gleichwertiger Fähigkeiten
  • Mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Führung eines Teams mit disziplinarischer Verantwortung
  • Expertise in der Managementberatung und im Portfoliomanagement
  • Sehr gute praktische und theoretische Kenntnisse im Themenfeld SAP Anwendungsmanagement
  • Umfassende Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen im Integrationsmanagement großer Anwendungsentwicklungs-Projekte und Steuerung externer Partner
  • ITIL-Kenntnisse mit entsprechenden Zertifizierungen
  • Profunde Kenntnisse im öffentlichen Vergaberecht
  • Fließende Deutschkenntnisse

Wir bieten:

  • Spannende und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben in einem innovativen und bedeutsamen Umfeld
  • Vielfältige interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie individuelle Karrieremodelle
  • Coaching-Angebote und Möglichkeiten zur Persönlichkeitsentwicklung in einer wertschätzenden Arbeitsatmosphäre
  • Gratis Fitnessstudio-Mitgliedschaft über Interfit und weitere attraktive Mitarbeitervergünstigungen Vertrauensarbeitszeit. Je nach Aufgabenfeld sind mobiles Arbeiten und flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle möglich
  • Ein attraktives Vergütungspaket inkl. arbeitgeberfinanzierter betrieblicher Altersvorsorge

Sagen Sie's gerne weiter!

Dann bewerben Sie sich hier über das Bewerbungsformular.

title: Anwendungsarchitekt (m/f/d) Portale/ Apps
description:
Die Aareon-Gruppe arbeitet mit ambitionierten Gründern zusammen, um neue Produkte und Dienstleistungen zu entwickeln. Jede neue Geschäftseinheit, die wir schaffen und finanzieren, zielt darauf ab, einen Mehrwert für unsere Kunden zu schaffen und das Lebens- und Arbeitserlebnis für Millionen von Menschen in Europa und darüber hinaus zu verbessern. Wir sind bestrebt, die Digitalisierung unserer Branche maßgeblich zu gestalten. Dazu entwickeln wir neue Geschäftsmodelle und investieren in Innovationen und neue Technologien.

Für unseren Digital Bereich suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Anwendungsarchitekt (m/f/d) Portale/ Apps in unbefristeter Anstellung.

Ihre Aufgabe - funktionale und konzeptionelle Gestaltung sowie Pflege unserer digitalen Lösungen:

  • Sie erarbeiten mit Entwicklern und Solution Managern Lösungskonzepte, Pflichtenhefte sowie Dokumentationen für moderne Anwendungen mit Web- , App- und Sprachschnittstellen unter Berücksichtigung der Kundenanforderungen
  • Sie unterstützen Entwickler und Solution Manager beim Wissenstransfer für interne und externe Kunden
  • Sie arbeiten eng mit internationalenTeams zusammen
  • Sie analysieren und verwalten die Kundenanforderungen an die unterstützten Produkte
  • Sie entwerfen und entwickeln Testfallkataloge, testen und dokumentieren Testfälle und arbeiten bei der Entwicklung von Testumgebungen mit
  • Sie sind Experte für die Analyse von Anwendungsproblemen zusammen mit unseren Kunden und die Organisation von Fehlerbehebungen in komplexen Umgebungen

Ihr Profil - Ein kreativer Denker und Problemlöser:

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium z.B. in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbaren Bereichen; alternativ eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im Bereich Webportale mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung.
  • Umfangreiche Erfahrung bei der Erstellung von technischen Konzepten und Spezifikationen
  • Erfahrung in Webentwicklung, App-Entwicklung, REST- Services und Nutzung von Plattformen mit Microservice-Architekturen
  • Erfahrung in der Implementierung von Web Security (z.B. OWASP)
  • Kompetenz im Projektmanagement und in agilen Methoden
  • Überzeugendes und selbstbewusstes Auftreten sowie starke Kommunikationsfähigkeit in allen Kundensituationen
  • Erfahrung in der Immobilienbranche ist von Vorteil
  • Fließende Deutschkenntnisse und ausgezeichnete Englischkenntnisse runden ihr Profil ab

Das bieten wir: Benefits - Mehr als nur eine Stützposition

  • Mit Innovation und intelligenter Technologie verändern Sie den Umgang der Menschen mit Immobilien entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette
  • Grenzen verschieben: Arbeiten Sie an unbekannten Herausforderungen und inspirieren Sie Ihre Kollegen
  • Freiraum und Flexibilität bei der persönlichen Arbeitszeitgestaltung, ein Outdoor-Office und die Möglichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten mit modernen Betriebsmitteln, Teamgeist und eine offene Kommunikation in einer dynamischen internationalen Community
  • Umfassende, individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und regelmäßiges Feedback
  • Attraktive Sozialleistungen (30 Tage Jahresurlaub sowie dienstfrei an Heiligabend, Silvester und Rosenmontag sowie vermögenswirksame Leistungen etc.)
  • Diverse Zusatzleistungen, wie ein gelebtes Gesundheitsmanagement und unser Betriebsrestaurant sowie Fahrradleasing
  • Eine gute öffentliche Verkehrsanbindung sowie kostenlose Mitarbeiterparkplätze

Neugierig? Wir auch!

Bewerben Sie sich gleich online über das Bewerbungsformular oder unsere Homepage aareon.de/karriere und senden Sie Ihre aussagekräftigen Bewerbungsunterlagen, unter Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung und Ihres nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermins, an Victoria Schneemann. Telefonisch steht sie Ihnen unter der Rufnummer +49 (0) 6131 / 301-290 gerne zur Verfügung.

title: Contract Software Developer  for Web Applications
description:
H&Co, the New York company that designs and publishes fonts, is looking for a smart, ambitious, and detail-oriented front-end developer who loves typography, and is ready to flex their muscles. Come and join us building the next generation of typography.com, and the award-winning discover.typography.com.

Our web applications serve a rare and refreshing audience: tech-savvy designers, the ones who are always running the latest nightly builds on the fastest hardware, but are the first to notice if animation gets triggered on window resize.

We’re looking for a developer who’s up to the challenge of delivering intuitive, performant, and thoughtful experiences to users who know the difference, and have come to expect the best. If you’re looking for an opportunity to do all the things you wish you could at your current job, to join a team of people who share your enthusiasm for what’s possible, and to work for a company that values invention, care, and getting it right, read on.

It goes without saying that we’re looking for candidates with impeccable chops: strong UX instincts, a sharp eye for detail, a mastery of current web technologies and practices, and an unshakable understanding of how the servers come together to deliver the site. You must be fluent in JavaScript using ReactJS and CSS3/HTML5, be familiar with a stylesheet language such as SASS, and live and breathe web standards and optimization. Come in with a list of technologies you’re excited to explore. Hands-on experience with digital typography is desirable, but not required. This is a contract position, available for either remote work, or working on-site at our New York office, or a combination of the two. The position is open to US citizens or those with authorization to work in the US.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work with our creative team to develop, implement, refine, and deploy new features and functionality across our web properties (typography.com, discover.typography.com, and try.typography.com)
  • Work with our technology and product management team to review project requirements, define criteria for testing, and work with technical management to assess project feasibility within the allotted timetable and budget
  • Develop and manage a web toolchain including build tools, preprocessors, and open- source libraries. You should be familiar with software such as React, Redux, Yarn, ES6, webpack, PostCSS, and other modern front-end development tools and methodologies
  • Understand user needs and behavior by utilizing site analytics, user testing, and data modeling, to refine and improve both web applications and back-office utilities
  • Implement refinements to existing services and create new ones, in order to address changes in standards, customer expectations, behavior patterns, and best practices
  • Coordinate version deployment within a quality assurance framework, using standards and processes that ensure that projects meet defined conditions and specifications
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of standards, emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices

Required Qualifications

  • A Bachelor's Degree in a technical or design field, or equivalent experience
  • Industry experience developing with current versions of HTML, CSS
  • Strong command and professional experience in JavaScript, ES6, and React implemented with RESTful APIs
  • Strong command of web standards, responsive and adaptive design, progressive enhancement and graceful degradation, optimization techniques, dynamic content retrieval, state management, and techniques for accessibility and device-portability
  • Experience writing maintainable code with thorough test coverage, using git SCM and git flow
  • Work experience with Linux/Apache/MySQL/PHP development
  • Experience with CMS theming, multiple frameworks, and databases
  • Work experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
how_to_apply: Please send a letter and résumé to Jimmy Mooney at mooney@typography.com. You’re welcome to include any other material that you feel distinguishes you as a candidate. Candidates only, no recruiters or third parties, please.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Yellowdig is looking for a Frontend Developer to join the team and take on aspects of our user interface and customer experience. We're looking for a candidate who has a strong background with modern javascript and a keen sense of design and style.

We are a dedicated team committed to solving some of the most challenging problems in education. How can today’s educators keep tomorrow’s students engaged and motivated? Our proven social learning platform has demonstrated higher engagement and learning outcome through collaboration, content curation and gamification.

You will work with our rapidly growing customer base to translate their needs into well designed features and functionality.

You:

  • are a self-starter, independent and resourceful
  • have shipped frontend code to end users
  • work well on in a startup environment
  • are interested in improving education
  • are flexible in sharing responsibility and wearing different hats

Technologies:

  • ES6 Javascript
  • React
  • Redux
  • CSS/Sass

Bonus Points (not required):

  • experience with functional programming techniques
  • Clojure/Clojurescript
  • Datomic

Compensation:

  • Competitive base
  • Stock options
  • Fully funded health, dental, vision and life insurance
  • Opportunity for rapid career growth

Location: Philadelphia, USA (Center City)

Opportunity to work with exceptionally talented peers in a fast paced start-up environment.

title: Full LAMP Stack Developer
description:
If you have extensive developer experience and you prefer to work on IT systems from top to bottom in a small business environment, we might be looking for each other.

We are a successful and growing manufacturing business of 30+ employees. In response to our business growth we are transitioning our IT department from a one-person shop to a small team. On this team you’ll have direct access to work on everything from Linux server administration to creating the next generation of our business applications, to web front-end development. You’ll interface directly with our team of 4 operational managers to learn their IT needs, and support the success of the business by modifying and extending our custom software systems.

Since this is a small team, we are looking for highly experienced, sharp, and interpersonally effective individuals who are eager and competent to take on significant responsibility and advanced technical challenges.

We love agile development, simple and elegant technical solutions, and a user-focused philosophy of service and support. Our tech stack is LAMP-centric. If you love Linux and open-source tools, we’ll get along great. If you love Microsoft products, and the phrase “Windows server” doesn’t make you twitchy… well, we’re never going to understand each other.

We hustle to get significant development work done every week. We work hard and focus from 8 to 5, Monday - Friday. We have lives/families too, and we don’t work evenings and weekends (with rare exceptions to address a downtime or security concern).

Essential Skills: Strong conceptual understanding of systems and coding logic. Strong PHP coding or similar. MySQL or other database-driven application development. HTML.

Helpful Skills: Perl coding, Linux administration, MySQL administration, Javascript, basic network configuration.

Compensation: Salary $100,000. Three weeks paid vacation. PTO, retirement, and QSEHRA health benefit.

We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage all interested candidates to apply.

title: Code Challenge Reviewer - 100% Remote - £50 per hour - Java, JavaScript, PHP, Python, C#, Ruby, CSS/HTML, SQL, Scala, iOS or Android
description:
Fancy earning extra cash reviewing code challenge submissions from any location?

We pay you £25 for each code challenge you review (30 minutes review time).  You can do as many or as few as you want per week.

We are looking for highly talented Java, JavaScript, PHP, Python, C#, Ruby, Scala, iOS and Android developers

Please read some comments made by our reviewers on Quora here 

We pay you via Transferwise, Revolut or Payoneer at the end of the month (unless you are in the UK, in which case we bank via bank transfer). 

To become part of the team you just need to register with us at Geektastic and take some code challenges. These are reviewed by our expert team (we need to know how great you are :))

Once you are part of the distributed team you will then be notified on our Slack channel when a new challenge is ready to be reviewed.

Feel free to email hello@geektastic.com if you have any questions

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you interested in joining a fast-growing tech startup in the heart of Downtown St. Louis? Balto is looking for our first DevOps engineer to join Balto on the ground-floor, grow alongside the organization, and ultimately nurture and develop the Balto DevOps team.

On day one, you'll be tasked with monitoring Balto's production system. In addition, you’ll be expected to:

  • Make high-pressure decisions in critical situations, including outages.
  • Work alongside Balto's engineering team to help people understand how their code will run in a production environment.
  • Perform research and make decisions around Balto's production architecture, including process designs for our AWS security group to ultimately play a lead role in an eventual move to containerization. In the long term, we hope this person will help establish and lead Balto's Reliability Team.

You should have experience with the following systems:

  • Linux (Ubuntu Server).
  • AWS (EC2).
  • VMs and Containers.
  • Unixy tools like bash, git, and systems.

Additional Skills:

  • Ability to develop, follow, and roll out new processes that maintain and improve Balto’s reliability.
  • Ability to make critical decisions under pressure.
  • Previous DevOps or engineering experience (2-3 years minimum).
  • Basic comfort with code and terminal environments.

Some of our benefits include

  • Equity Stock Options
  • PTO and Paid Holidays
  • Health Insurance, including Dental and Vision
  • Life and Disability Insurance
  • Free Parking/Commuter Benefits
  • T-REX membership
  • Dog-friendly office

Balto recently made an enormous investment to develop our DevOps environment. It's already a crucial component of our success and our ability to continue to build new and exciting features. We are incredibly excited to welcome our first DevOps engineer to the Balto team.

Balto is an artificial intelligence tool that transcribes and analyzes sales calls in real-time to deliver live recommendations to sales reps while they navigate their calls. Sales reps use Balto to improve their communication skills, better understand customers’ needs, and consistently remember the key points that they need to address on every call. At Balto, you will experience firsthand the limitless passion and critical strategy that go into building a technology company from the ground up.

Balto is headquartered in the T-REX incubator, an innovative space in downtown St. Louis that houses a community of technologists and entrepreneurs. If you are excited about contributing to a successful, early-stage startup, please apply.

Balto is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual preference, age, and veteran or disability status.

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:
Company description At Red Hat, we connect an innovative community of customers, partners, and contributors to deliver an open source stack of trusted, high-performing solutions. We offer cloud, Linux, middleware, storage, and virtualization technologies, together with award-winning global customer support, consulting, and implementation services. Red Hat is a rapidly growing company supporting more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Job summary The Red Hat Engineering team is looking for a Principal Software Engineer to join us in Westford, MA to work on the KubeVirt project. In this role, you will design and implement virtualization solutions for containers and virtual machines (VMs), contributing to industry-leading technologies like Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift, libvirt, and QEMU. As a part of a geographically distributed team you will collaborate with multiple Red Hat engineering teams and open source communities around the globe. You’ll need to be motivated and curious with a passion for problem solving, Linux technologies, and open source.

Primary job responsibilities Play an active role in container and virtualization-related projects and communities, such as KubeVirt, Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift, libvirt, and QEMU Create and guide new feature development; contribute to open source projects in Golang and Python Integrate changes in multiple projects and services into a consumable feature Submit patches for bug fixes to the community and review patches from other members Work with the Quality Engineering (QE) team to ensure projects are tested correctly Publicize the team's work through blogs, web postings, or conference talks Required skills Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent work experience Interest in the container ecosystem (Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift) and Golang Experience in storage and storage protocols, including NFS, iSCSI, etc. 5+ years of experience in a Linux environment working with either Golang, Python, Java, or C or C++ Experience in Linux system programming Multi-threaded programming and management of shared resources synchronization in complex environments Motivated with the ability to quickly learn new technologies Good written and verbal communication skills in English Familiarity with virtualization, clusters, and container-related technologies like Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift, Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM), and Red Hat OpenStack Platform is a plus Open source development experience is a plus

Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Django)
description:
About the Role

Standard is looking for a senior backend engineer to build, maintain, and shape the APIs that support our applications for online video creators. You’ll be joining a team of senior full stack and mobile engineers, and will have lots of autonomy and immediate impact in controlling the direction of the application and the technology decisions surrounding it. You’ll work with creators directly to help identify needs and deliver products to support their work.

Responsibilities

  • Own, develop, and maintain the APIs—written in Django with a sprinkling of Ruby—that support our applications for creators, sponsors, and end-users
  • Own and develop the web application used by creators and sponsors currently built in React, Redux, SASS and Django
  • Own and develop an analytics pipeline used to generate insides from various data sources (YouTube, Patreon, podcast analytics, et cetera)
  • Help develop the technology roadmap going forward
  • Take new features from idea to shipped product
  • Work with creators and sponsors to identify improvements

What We're Looking For

  • 5+ years of back-end engineering experience building and maintaining user-facing applications and APIs, preferably with Django
  • Experience building applications on AWS
  • Front end experience a plus, but not required (React, Redux, CSS)
  • Excited about online video and podcasts
  • Good communicator
  • Patient & considerate
  • Independent & self-motivated

Perks

  • Competitive salary, plus equity in Standard
  • Flexible work hours and vacation policy
  • Diverse, socially-minded team of nice people
  • Access to our wonderful NYC and Denver offices
  • Medical, dental, and vision plans (for US-based employees)
  • 401(k) and other benefits
  • You'll get to work with some of the best creators on YouTube

About Us

Standard is a sort of talent management agency and production company for thoughtful YouTubers and podcasters. We do a lot of things, so it's hard to explain it all in a single paragraph, but our mission is to empower independent creators. Most of our time is spent talking or working with the creators directly, one on one or in a group, coming up with better tools and toys for them.

We're a distributed company. We have offices in NYC and Denver, but more than 50% of the team is remote, in exotic locations like the UK, the Netherlands, France, and Ohio.

Because we're distributed and because most of our tasks aren't immediately time-sensitive we don't really have operating hours, per se. There are things to do and meetings to be had, but we pride ourselves on our flexibility. We think this makes Standard a great place to work for people with families, or whose productive hours tend to be outside of the 9-5. We care about what you do more than when you do it.

How We Hire

We think that diversity is important. Many of us have non-traditional backgrounds. We work in the online education space, so we understand how much can be learned on your own, on the Internet, outside of a classroom.

We're looking for people who are curious and passionate. Our team should be made up of people of all sorts of colors, genders, and sizes, who can help to expand our perspective and improve our ability to treat our creators and our audience with thoughtfulness and empathy.

If that sounds like you, we're happy to care less how many years of experience you have or where you went to school. Apply anyway. And if you have any feedback on how we could reach or appeal to a more diverse pool of talent, get in touch.
how_to_apply:
Send an email to jobs@standard.tv and include:

• The position.

• What excited you about the role.

• Your resume, obviously.

• Links to relevant work available online (github, etc).

• A note or two about your interests outside of work. This is usually more interesting than the resume part.

Tip: "tv" is part of our domain, not our name.

title: Senior .NET Software Engineer
description:
Delphian Systems, LLC is looking for a Senior .NET Developer to join our team and build functional applications and websites.

Founded in 2011 with a team of trailblazing IoT pioneers and an end-to-end solution in the Smart Building IoT space Delphian is in the process of scaling up its business with existing and new strategic OEM partners.

The Delphian solution comprises a full IoT stack technology platform, a commercial smart product platform, and salient services that allow OEMs to migrate successfully their product offerings and business models to the new IoT market economy. Key benefits are market dominance with higher value product ecosystems, maximum speed-to-market, and lowest total life-cycle costs. Delphian successes and capabilities span applications in security, access control, safety, convenience, and intelligent automation for building managers, tenants, visitors, and service providers.

Senior .NET Developer responsibilities include object-oriented programming concepts, developing comprehensive unit tests, writing testable code and building IoT applications/systems.

Ultimately, you'll use your software engineering skills to develop highly scalable, distributed systems and services.

Requirements:

  • Expert knowledge of SDLC processes and best practices.
  • Expert .NET Framework/.NET Core application architecture and C# skills.
  • Expert knowledge of object-oriented programming concepts.
  • Expert knowledge of various application architectures with a focus on Service Oriented Architecture and building high-volume distributed systems.
  • Expert knowledge of database technologies, including but not limited to Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Azure, Cosmos DB and other database technologies.
  • Expert knowledge of O/RM technologies, including .NET Entity Framework, EFCore and NHibernate.
  • Strong experience with developing comprehensive unit tests and writing testable code.
  • Strong experience with Docker, DevOps procedures, CI/CD pipelines and source control systems.
  • Strong familiarity with Microsoft Azure offerings and some familiarity of AWS and GCP offerings.
  • Experience participating in Scrum ceremonies such as Daily Scrum, Spring Review & Retrospective.
  • Front-end development experience using ASP.NET MVC, React, Angular, HTML/CSS, Javascript and Typescript.
  • Experience with building IoT applications/systems.
  • Knowledge of UI patterns and best practices, including responsive and mobile-first.
  • Software as a Service (SaaS) experience.
  • Kubernetes deployment/management experience.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.
  • 8+ years of experience as a software developer.
  • Experienced in the use of Agile Work item management tools such as JIRA and Azure DevOps.
  • Excellent interpersonal communications. Must have the ability to help product managers formulate/articulate decisions on the course of action.
  • Comfortable in presenting to senior management and client representatives.
  • Self-motivated to learn new tools, technology, & process, and be forward compatible.
  • Expertise in a wide variety of software architecture and engineering concepts, practices and procedures, relying on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
  • Flexible to shifting priorities.
  • Legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.

title: Senior .NET/Web Applications Developer
description:
The Bank for International Settlements is an international organisation which fosters international monetary and financial cooperation via wide-ranging banking, economic research and policy coordination activities.

Your contribution to our mission

The Corporate Applications and Workflow (CAW) team is responsible for developing and maintaining software platforms that are used across the Bank to provide core shared services and automate business processes. These platforms help and enable the different business units (HR, Finance, Security and other shared services) to provide their services to the entire Bank.

You will apply your deep knowledge in web and Microsoft technologies to deliver projects addressing a wide variety of business issues. You will work in a variety of applications, ranging from custom-built software to commercial off-the-shelf products. There will also be opportunities to supervise external developers in project work.

As the team follow agile principles and techniques, you should be comfortable working in that type of environment and have prior experience with one of the major agile methodologies.

Principal accountabilities:

  • Provides technical leadership and product management expertise for several corporate applications

  • Provides leadership in agile processes and rituals; mediates team discussions

  • Analyses business requirements, extracts technological needs from users’ requirements and translates them into workable product backlog items.

  • Ensures that the design meets business requirements and that stakeholders understand the benefits, drawbacks, risks, costs and time scales of design decisions.

  • Provides production support for designated applications on her/his own or with the help of internal or external resources.

  • Co-ownership of Microsoft Azure DevOps Server 2019, responsible for product management, support and enhancements.

  • Manages small projects and coordinates activities with team and stakeholders

Work experience and skills:

  • At least five years’ experience in designing and implementing large scale .Net and web applications.

  • Strong hands-on experience with several of the following technologies: C#, Web API, Entity Framework, AngularJS, TypeScript, Javascript, SQL Server, Microsoft WF.

  • Solid knowledge of design and integration patterns

  • Solid knowledge of multi-tier architectures and microservices

  • In depth understanding of best practices and tooling for CI/CD pipelines, Azure DevOps 2019, automated testing, code quality and package management.

  • Hands on experience with containers is a plus.

  • Good knowledge of SOA and DDD.

  • Experience in business process modelling/implementation.

  • Experience with secure software development lifecycle is a plus.

  • Very good communication skills; ability to establish strong working relationships with business areas and infrastructure teams.

  • Ability to take the initiative and organise own work; flexibility; service orientation; ability to perform under pressure against tight deadlines.

  • Good problem solving and root cause analysis approach.

Additional informations

title: Medior .Net Developer
description:
Städte lebenswerter machen, das ist unser Motto. Das setzen wir bei Greenwheels jeden Tag in die Tat um. Ein Greenwheels-Auto ersetzt 11 private Autos und so schaffen wir Platz in unseren immer voller werdenden Städten. Wir wissen nur allzu gut, dass man ein Auto nicht besitzen muss, um es nutzen zu können. Wir bieten unseren Service in Deutschland und den Niederlanden an, unser Büro in Deutschland ist in Dortmund, wo wir mit rund 8 Kollegen arbeiten.

Das Carsharing-Konzept basiert zu einem großen Teil auf unseren IT-Lösungen, und Du, als Medior .NET Developer, kannst uns bei der Weiterentwicklung von Greenwheels wesentlich helfen und das Greenwheels Angebot entscheidend verbessern!

Medior .Net Developer

(Vollzeit – Dortmund)

Was wirst Du tun?

Als Medior .Net Developer entwickelst und wartest Du die Systeme und Anwendungen, die von und für Greenwheels verwendet werden. Zusammen mit dem Team kreierst, analysierst und bewertest Du neue Lösungsmöglichkeiten, und setzt diese final um. Um ein gutes Endergebnis für unsere Kunden und Endverbraucher zu erzielen, arbeitest Du eng mit anderen Entwicklern (intern und extern), Testern und verschiedenen Produkt-Ownern zusammen. Unser reguläres IT-Team besteht heute aus acht Personen, von denen sechs in den Niederlanden (Rotterdam) arbeiten. Außerdem arbeiten wir mit externen Partnern in verschiedenen Teilen Europas zusammen. Wir arbeiten agil, nach der Scrum-Methode, haben DevOps und Tester im Team, verwenden Tools wie Jira und Slack, und wir sind auf dem Weg zu Continuous Delivery und in die „Cloud“.

Wen suchen wir?

Als unser Spitzenkandidat •Solltest Du mindestens eine technische Berufsausbildung abgeschlossen haben (Informatik ist von Vorteil)

  • Hast Du ein paar Jahre Erfahrung als .Net Developer
  • Hast Du vorzugsweise Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen mit objektorientierten Programmiersprachen wie C#, .Net, SQL , JSON, REST und Micro Services
  • Bist Du neugierig und lernwillig
  • Bist Du proaktiv und gründlich bei Deiner Arbeit
  • Freust Du Dich auf die Arbeit in einem internationalen Team
  • Kommunizierst Du mit Leichtigkeit, sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch.

Was bieten wir?

  • ein marktgerechtes Gehalt
  • 30 Urlaubstage im Jahr
  • die Möglichkeit, sich intern weiter zu entwickeln
  • ein Rabatt auf ein Greenwheels-Abonnement, weil es toll ist, wenn Du auch ein Greenwheels-Auto fährst
  • flexible Arbeitszeiten, damit Du Deine Arbeit und Deine persönlichen Aktivitäten besser kombinieren kannst

Wer sind wir?

Seit fast 25 Jahren arbeiten wir daran, unsere Städte durch unsere innovativen und nachhaltigen Lösungen zugunsten einer effizienten Mobilität lebenswerter zu machen. Wir sind ein informelles Unternehmen mit fast 50 Mitarbeitern, wo eigentlich jeder Tag ein Casual Friday ist. Wir haben unseren Sitz in den Niederlanden (Rotterdam) und in Dortmund (wo Du arbeiten würdest). Und wir wachsen schneller als je zuvor. Wir sind pragmatisch und bevorzugen kurze Wege bei unserer Arbeit. Endlose Meetings sind definitiv nicht unser Ding! Wir ziehen es vor, sofort anzupacken. Und wenn Du Fragen hast, kannst Du jederzeit bei Deinen Kollegen „vorbeigehen“ und sie fragen.

Fragen? Oder willst Du Dich gleich bewerben?

Für Fragen zu diesem Stellenangebot stehen wir Dir gerne zur Verfügung. Bei Fragen zum Bewerbungsverfahren wende Dich bitte an Dorine Veelders (Personalberaterin) unter hr@greenwheels.nl. Bei Fragen zur konkreten Stelle kannst Du Dich an unseren IT-Manager (der damit auch Dein Manager würde), Sander Groenenberg, wenden unter sander.groenenberg@greenwheels.nl. Sind Sie ein Recruiter, dann kontaktieren Sie uns bitte nicht, wir nehmen bei Bedarf zu Ihnen Kontakt auf!

Möchtest Du Dich jetzt bewerben? Du kannst Deinen Lebenslauf und Dein Anschreiben per E-Mail an Dorine senden unter solliciteren@greenwheels.nl oder bewirb Dich jetzt über diesen Link! Wir werden uns schnellstmöglich mit Dir in Verbindung setzen! Das gesamte Bewerbungsverfahren besteht aus zwei Interviews und zwei Tests (ein Programmierfall und ein Online-Assessment). Ohne Anschreiben eingereichte Lebensläufe werden wir nicht berücksichtigen, da wir wirklich erfahren wollen, warum Du mit uns zusammenarbeiten möchtest und warum Du glaubst, dass Du zu unserem Unternehmen passt.
how_to_apply: Klicken Sie hier um zum Bewerbungsformular zu gelangen!

title: Cloud Infrastructure Architect
description:
The Bank for International Settlements is an international organisation which fosters international monetary and financial cooperation via wide-ranging banking, economic research and policy coordination activities.

Your contribution to our mission

The Cloud Engineering team is part of the IT Applications and Platforms group within the Bank’s IT department (IMS). Partnering with other areas of the business, it is responsible for delivering the Bank’s core cloud platforms and services. You will have experience designing and implementing enterprise infrastructure solutions in the public cloud, using multi-vendor IaaS and PaaS services, to facilitate secure hybrid connectivity with existing on-premises infrastructure.

This position is a key hire in a newly created cloud engineering team and will involve working with other areas of the business to enable the organisation to realise its strategic cloud goals. This position will report directly to the Head of Cloud Engineering and will be a key contributor to our enterprise cloud strategy.

Principal accountabilities:

  • Design and implement of cloud infrastructure roadmaps, with a focus on public cloud architecture

  • Contribute to the implementation of a bank-wide cloud adoption and governance framework

  • Collate business requirements and translate them into technical solutions

  • Maintain and support cloud platforms and services

  • Contribute toward cloud product management (service management, supplier management, budget preparation, management of enhancements pipeline, compliance with internal policies, release management)

  • Manage small to medium-size projects.

Qualification and work experience:

  • Master’s degree or equivalent experience in a related subject

  • At least five years of demonstrable hands-on experience with IaaS and PaaS, from delivering successful enterprise projects in the public cloud, preferably multi-vendor. Experience with Microsoft Azure is a must-have

  • Experience in architecting public cloud solutions for enterprise level infrastructure workloads

  • Cloud cost management experience, including planning and optimising services to budget, whilst still being able to scale to performance expectations

  • Solid experience in network design, including multi-site and external connectivity, firewall rules and routing protocols. ExpressRoute a plus.

  • Hands-on experience with provisioning and configuration management tools (e.g. Terraform, Puppet, Chef, Ansible)

  • Experience designing and implementing cloud governance and controls

Required skills and knowledge:

  • Deep domain expertise of cloud infrastructure solutions; including Windows and Linux IaaS, security, management, storage, networking, monitoring, containers, infrastructure-as-code

  • Fluency in enterprise infrastructure, networking and security topics with the ability to comfortably work with SMEs from each, translating between both cloud and on-premises concepts

  • A natural preference to DevOps orientated practices, with automation and reusability as standard (incl. ARM template and Blueprinting knowhow)

  • Strong Identity and Authentication knowledge, including AD/AAD and Federation, OAuth and OpenID

  • Fluency in scripting languages (e.g. PowerShell, Bash); very strong in PowerShell Ability to learn and adopt emerging cloud trends and technologies, across vendors

Additional informations:

Employment - Duration: 3 years Contract type: Fixed-term Application Deadline: 30/11/2019

All new staff members are recruited on a fixed-term basis without expectation either of any contract renewal or conversion. The contract may however be extended or converted to an open-ended one at the end of the term, subject to organisational needs and individual performance. The BIS is fully committed to equal opportunity employment and strives for diversity among its staff.

title: Software Developer - Vastgoed
description:
Momenteel ontwikkelen we volop nieuwe oplossingen voor de schadeafhandeling van vastgoedobjecten. Dit is een business line die hard groeit. We hebben een gedreven Developer nodig die deze groei samen met het team mogelijk weet te maken. Past dit bij jou?

Waarom pas jij bij Solera?

Solera NL is onderdeel van het wereldwijd opererende Solera, dat jaarlijks 230 miljoen transacties verwerkt. Met 180.000 klanten in meer dan 90 landen beogen wij de klantervaring te verrijken, voor de 10% van de berijders die jaarlijks schade rijdt maar zeker ook voor de 90% die dat niet doet.

Vandaag de dag reikt ons platform voorbij de schadeclaim en leveren we oplossingen voor alle momenten in de levenscyclus van een auto, maar gaan door naar de garage waarin je die parkeert én ook het huis dat ernaast staat. We zijn begonnen aan een missie om het goed, beter en anders te doen en op die weg gaan we verder.

Vanuit Zeist leveren we slimme IT-diensten op het gebied van communicatie, informatie en schades. Dankzij onze diensten kunnen klanten efficiënter communiceren, samenwerken, nauwkeurige risicoanalyses maken en betrouwbare schadeberekeningen opstellen, voor auto én huis. We zetten standaarden neer, leveren vaste bouwstenen en ontwikkelen nieuwe oplossingen. Hier kun jij als ervaren Developer een significante bijdrage aan leveren!

Wees welkom in een mooi team

Je wordt een belangrijk onderdeel van ons development-team. Dit team is bezig om een innovatieve oplossing voor de afhandeling van schades aan huizen te ontwikkelen: een hub tussen alle betrokken partijen (consument, verzekeraar, intermediair, hersteller, expert) die Straight Through Processing (STP) maximaal faciliteert.

Wat jou kenmerkt? Specialistische kennis, ondernemerschap en innovatiekracht

Samen met het team van Developers, een Business Analyst en een Product Owner worden nieuwe diensten en uitbreidingen aan bestaande software gerealiseerd. In het development-team ben je een belangrijke kracht voor het realiseren van onze nieuwe diensten. Ons team werkt agile en is in staat om snel en flexibel op te leveren. Dit vergt intensieve samenwerking tussen collega’s, waarbij we altijd streven naar de juiste mix in kennis en ervaring binnen een team. We zoeken iemand die zich hierin herkent:

  • Minimaal hbo-niveau en werkzaam op senior niveau;
  • Analytisch sterk;
  • Enthousiast en gedreven om samen resultaten te boeken;
  • Een innovatieve, creatieve en nieuwsgierige instelling, en goed in staat om zelfstandig te werken;
  • Gedreven om kennis en ervaring met anderen te delen;
  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en de Engelse taal.

Daarnaast ben je vertrouwd met onderstaande stack:

  • Microsoft Visual Studio, C#, .NET Core;
  • HTML5, JavaScript, SCSS;
  • XML, XML Schema, JSON, JSON Schema, REST API development;
  • MongoDB.

Wij bieden uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals:

  • Flexibele werktijden;
  • Aandacht voor vitaliteit, o.a. door korting op een sportabonnement;
  • Ruime mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling d.m.v. training en opleiding;
  • Salarisindicatie per jaar o.b.v. 40u €45.000 – 55.000 all-in (afhankelijk van ervaring).

Help jij onze dienstverlening verder naar een volgend niveau?

Herken je jezelf in het profiel? We zien dit graag terug in je CV en een korte motivatie, die kun je sturen naar Sander Huininga (recruiter) via de deze link. We streven ernaar om binnen twee weken feedback te geven op jouw sollicitatie!

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Wissenschaftliche*r Mitarbeiter*in Sensorik und Infrastruktur  Autonomes Fahren
description:

Wir suchen ab sofort für das Kompetenzzentrum Autonomes Fahren eine* n motivierte* n

Wissenschaftliche * n Mitarbeiter * in Sensorik und Infrastruktur – Autonomes Fahren (m/w/d)

Kennziffer 120-2019, in Vollzeit, Vergütung TV-L bis E 13

Mit dem Kompetenzzentrum Autonomes Fahren soll eine zentrale Anlaufstelle aufgebaut werden, die relevante Themen aufgreift, bündelt und die Mobilitätsakteure u.a. mit Informations- und Beratungsangeboten unterstützt. Im Mittelpunkt stehen dabei die Initiierung eines Lern- und Wissenstransferprozesses über alle Ebenen des Innovationssystems sowie die Anwendung und Verbreitung von Lösungen für die Umsetzung des autonomen Fahrens.

Ihre Aufgaben:

  • Verantwortliche Konzeption, Organisation, Durchführung und Auswertung der Projektaufgaben im Bereich Sensorik und Infrastrukturerfordernisse
  • Entwicklung und Erprobung von Sensorprototypen und Datenverarbeitung in den Reallaboren
  • Unterstützung der Weiterentwicklung der Simulationsumgebung mit erhobenen Sensordaten und Umfeldmodellen
  • Unterstützung des kontinuierlichen Technologiemonitorings im Projekt (Schwerpunkt: Sensorik und weitere Infrastrukturtechnologien)
  • Unterstützung bei Transferaufgaben

Ihr Profil:

  • Abgeschlossene Hochschulausbildung (Bachelor oder Master) in Informatik, Informationstechnik, Elektrotechnik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mensch-Technik-Interaktion oder vergleichbarem Studiengang
  • Kenntnisse in mindestens einem der folgenden Bereiche: Sensorik, Infrastruktur, Signalverarbeitung, Automotive, Maschinelles Lernen, Bildverarbeitung
  • Kenntnisse im Verfassen von (wissenschaftlichen) Veröffentlichungen sowie Pressemitteilungen und Fachbeiträgen
  • Kommunikationsstärke in Wort und Schrift (deutsch und englisch) sowie sicheres Auftreten
  • Erfahrungen und ausgeprägtes Interesse an digitalen Zukunftsthemen und Automotive
  • Interdisziplinäre Projekterfahrung vorteilhaft
  • Programmiererfahrung in Python, C++ oder Matlab wünschenswert

Wir bieten:

  • Arbeit auf einem neuen und modernen Campus
  • Eine interessante, abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Tätigkeit in einem netten Team

title: Web Software Developer supporting Data Science (f/m/d)
description:
European XFEL is an international non-profit company located in the Hamburg area in Germany. It operates a 3.4 km long X-ray laser, which produces X-rays of unique quality for studies in physics, chemistry, the life sciences, materials research and other disciplines. The diverse scientific facilities at European XFEL enable scientists from across the globe to carry out a wide range of experimental techniques. Early user operation started in September 2017.

In the context of the PaNOSC (Photon and Neutron Open Science Cloud, www.panosc.eu, github.com/panosc-eu) project which is funded by the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement number 823852)

we are looking for a Web Software Developer supporting Data Science (f/m/d)

The Position

  • design and development of new and existing web applications required for supporting European XFEL in the context of the PaNOSC project

  • integration of new data reduction strategies into the existing operational services (catalogue, web services, data transfer)

  • participation in testing, maintenance, documentation, and support of the products developed and later upgrades

  • preparation of documentation related to the projects deliverables

Requirements

  • bachelor in Information Systems or related field, or equivalent experience

  • ideally, have minimum 2 years of experience with Ruby on Rails or other web Frameworks

  • experience in management of large scientific datasets is an asset

  • a strong background and knowledge of RESTful, CSS, and MySQL

  • knowledge of PHP, Python or Javascript would be an advantage

  • good knowledge of Linux

  • very good communication skills in English

For additional information please contact Krzysztof Wrona (krzysztof.wrona@xfel.eu).

Working place will be Schenefeld in the Hamburg metropolitan area. General information on working in Germany, the Hamburg area and the European XFEL can be found here.

Our Offer Become part of a vibrant international and multicultural team of scientists, engineers, technical, and administrative staff. Be involved in cutting edge scientific and technical progress, participate in our international networks, and shape your life upon trust-based flexible working times and telecommuting options. Experience our atmosphere of tolerance and respect.

Remuneration Salary and benefits are similar to those of public service organizations in Germany. In addition, European XFEL provides a non-contributory company pension scheme, broad relocation benefits, a subsidized job-ticket for the local public transportation system, as well as our brand-new company restaurant BeamStop. The European XFEL GmbH employs a diverse, broadly international staff. Non-German candidates hired from abroad receive an international allowance.

Reference number: E-237

Duration: This appointment is limited to 3 years.

Application Please apply online and provide a cover letter next to a CV in English, as well as your work certificates in one single pdf-file. Handicapped persons will be given preference over other equally qualified applicants. The European XFEL GmbH is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and encourages applications from women.

Deadline: December 12th 2019

European XFEL GmbH Holzkoppel 4, 22869 Schenefeld, Germany www.xfel.eu

title: Senior Scala Engineer
description:
VakantieDiscounter (Elmar Reizen BV) is the leading online travel agency in The Netherlands where our customers experience an easier and more comfortable way of booking their holiday: www.vakantiediscounter.nl.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer that will join our growing development department, where you will be part of an agile feature team. Your talent and experience with software development on the JVM will help us become more innovative, improve our productivity, and continue to live up to our high standards. Your focus will be on the Travel Platform that connects Tour Operator inventories to our website by processing large amounts of data for efficient search in our search solution and facilitates booking via our API integration layer.

All systems are built in-house with our own international development teams leverage technologies such as:

  • Scala, Akka HTTP and the Play framework for a scalable stateless REST back-end
  • Apache Spark, for distributed data processing
  • HELM, Kubernetes for running our systems on GCP
  • Clojure/ClojureScript for our website
  • A/B experiments, for sensible decision making

You will be writing lots of high-quality code that goes to production continuously and spend ±10% on R&D to find the next big thing.

Your skills and qualifications

  • You are a seasoned Scala Engineer (4+ years) with solid experience working in an Agile environment
  • You have a deep understanding of the JVM and code optimizations
  • You have experience with Spark, Hadoop, or other distributed data processing platforms
  • You have experience with DevOps and improving CI/CD pipelines
  • You know functional programming and have a passion for learning and sharing your knowledge

We consider it a plus if you have experience with:

  • Cats, Scalaz, functional programming libraries
  • Kubernetes, Docker, container-based deployments
  • Clojure and/or ClojureScript
  • Open Source; because we contribute back to the ecosystem

What we offer

  • Competitive remuneration package
  • A developer-focused workspace at our Amsterdam office
  • A fast-growing and flat organization with the possibility of flexible working hours and benefits in terms - of health, pension, and fun initiatives, team buildings, and events
  • The opportunity to develop through courses, conferences, and events
  • 24 paid holidays and 6 ATV days
  • Discount on your holiday trips
  • Support with relocation (visa, housing, 30% tax ruling)

About De VakantieDiscounter

The VakantieDiscounter (Elmar Reizen BV) is an online travel agency from the Benelux and was founded over 20 years ago. From 2009 to 2019, the company has grown its revenue 50x. At the moment, VakantieDiscounter is embarking on an internationalization journey, starting with Germany and further expanding into several other countries in Europe.

The company is continuously focused on innovative improvements and quality, not only with regards to the platform but also in terms of channels to reach and support the customer. The ever-prevailing goal is to make it easier and more comfortable for the customer to select a nice holiday.

The vibrant VakantieDiscounter office, with an international team of 90 people, is located on the Amsterdam canals in the center of the city. The organization is flat, democratic and based on trust, and employees have a lot of freedom in achieving success through their own preferred approach.

Questions?

Is this the job for you? Respond quickly to this vacancy! We would like to receive your CV via the application button below. Do you have any questions? Then contact our CTO, Sjors Grijpink at sgrijpink@elmar.nl

title: Senior Full Stack Developer (PHP)
description:
Scale is a tech-driven,direct-to-consumer platform that develops and deploys cutting-edge consumer brands from concept to scale, efficiently, profitably and quickly. We are obsessed with perfecting our proprietary technology, processes and methodologies that allow for rapid growth, from inception to SCALE.

Together we have a lifetime of experience in health, nutrition, entertainment, advertising, creative, media buying, strategy, performance optimization, and leadership. We have achieved success that has resulted in thousands of lives changed and millions of dollars in revenue.

We use an analytical approach and technology to power our growth engine, and are looking for an experienced senior full-stack engineer to join and help build and improve our web properties. You’ll work with our team of engineers to build and maintain features that create rich and compelling experiences for our customers, and expand the platform that drives our business operations.

Responsibilities:

Write and maintain code primarily in PHP and JavaScript (along with other languages as needed) Design / architect / build new applications, features, and tools Help improve system performance and scalability Help track down and fix system bugs Help mentor junior developers Qualifications: 5+ years experience developing web applications 3+ years of PHP experience with an MVC framework Experience with frontend Javascript libraries/frameworks (jQuery, React, Angular) Experience building and consuming APIs and web services Experience working with relational databases such as MySQL containing large amounts of data Strong grasp of technologies across the stack from the browser to the server Strong understanding of the browser DOM Strong communication skills both written and verbal

Bonus Qualifications:

Experience with Node.js Experience with additional languages such as Go, Python, Java, etc. Hands on experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker / Kubernetes) Contributions to open source projects

Who We Are:

Scale owns and operates several brands in the health and beauty verticals (our biggest - https://1md.org, https://hairlavie.com). We formulate best-in-class supplement and care products based on clinical studies and in partnership with doctors and medical labs. We sell our products online on eCommerce websites that are powered by our in-house eCommerce platform, built with the Zend Framework (LEMP stack). Our eCommerce platform controls every aspect of our websites as well as many of our business operations, such as customer service, inventory management, deep reporting and analytics and much more.

What We Offer:

Competitive Salary Commensurate with Years of Experience Medical, dental, vision and life insurance Gym Membership Office Snacks Yoga, meditation and dance breaks Casual Dress Company Outings Paid time off

Local Candidates Highly Preferred

title: Software Engineer III
description:
Who We Are:

The Limelight Health Software Platform is changing the employee benefits industry with its revolutionary, SaaS-based, mobile/desktop, enterprise solution.

Work as a team in a technical, creative, driven environment with other engineers as we reinvent health insurance quoting!

The Limelight Platform is an end-to-end, cloud-based, desktop and mobile insurance quoting and underwriting solution for B2B insurance professionals that is leading the technical revolution of the industry.

Limelight Health is largely remote with offices in San Francisco, Redding, and Des Moines with a flexible work environment and atmosphere. Visit us at (https://limelighthealth.com).

What We Offer:

  • Remote work option available

  • Equity (via stock options)

  • Knowing your product is making a difference
  • Widespread demonstrated appreciation
  • Direct working relationship with original founders
  • The knowledge that investors are using the product

Software Engineer III Overview:

Candidates are expected to have full stack Javascript experience and contribute to the success of Limelight Health by taking ownership of key product areas and developing functionality in an agile CI/CD environment. Must be able to continue to develop your own knowledge and skill-set to bring value as we grow.

  • Bachelor’s degree (BS/BA) in Computer Information Systems, Software Engineering or a related field preferred or equivalent experience.

Responsive Web Application development Cross browser compatibility Unit testing (Jasmine/Karma) NodeJS Javascript ECMA 6+ TypeScript AngularJS Angular Material NPM Express Promises with Q node Promises with $q BreezeJS Lodash Postgres AWS & AWS CLI RESTful Services Understanding of containerization (Docker) Industry experience a plus

  • Supporting and implementing the latest standards in securing data at rest and in transit

Please do not apply to this job unless you are authorized to work in the US. We are unable to offer sponsorship at this time.

Limelight Health is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

title: Backend Engineer (f/m/d) for Mobility Service Provider Squad
description:
Hi,

We are Anton, Ben, Bernd, Delia, Mark, Ulf, Patrick and Philip from the Mobility Service Provider (MSP) Squad. As an interdisciplinary team we focus on integrating mobility service providers for car-sharing, scooters, bike-sharing and ride-hailing such as car2go, TIER or FREE NOW (formerly mytaxi) into our urban mobility platform. We care greatly about quality, scalability, ease of use and a great user experience. We’re looking for a backend-focused engineer to join our squad.

First a quick look at us

The subject of mobility is evolving at a startling pace. Fundamentals are being questioned, new ways of getting around are emerging and challenging the established ones. At moovel (becomes REACH NOW), we aim to take part in shaping that future. Software is eating the world and mobility is certainly no exception. Ultimately, we want to help cities become smarter by building on the operational wisdom of city administrations and mobility service providers. We don't want to disrupt, but augment the means of getting around by employing contemporary technology.

The problems we are engaging are manifold and from the real world. Our solutions do not only have an impact on a single industry branch, but also aim to transform the city. They involve fields like routing, searching, AI, innovative UX and much more. Things are very dynamic in the mobility space and thus we devote ourselves to a lot of exploratory work.

How the role works

We are building services that provide a fully fledged feature set of urban mobility service providers. Our backend enables the moovel mobility app to find nearby mobility options like car or bike-sharing as well as scooters and ride-hailing services. It also allows booking functionality and handles payment.

Our services interact with moovel’s mobility platform as well as external APIs. Many of our services are also exposed to external partners, so they have to be well documented, stable and easy to use. Implementing new services in a consistent way is also very important to us.

Some of the things you will do

  • Work in the Mobility Service Provider (MSP) Squad together with other backend engineers, mobile engineers, QA engineers and designers
  • Build microservices with Node.js written in TypeScript and deployed on AWSdesign and implement APIs for discovering mobility points, booking flows and payment for mobility services
  • Design and implement APIs for discovering mobility points, booking flows and payment for mobility services.
  • Integrate APIs from third-party mobility service providers into our platform.
  • As we follow agile principles, you will participate in defining our products and building them. Your input is valued!

About you

  • You are an experienced backend-focussed software engineer and like building services using well-defined APIs
  • You know about Node.js (ideally TypeScript) or are willing to learn it. We believe in hiring great engineers, not programming language experts.
  • You know how to operate services in production: deploying, performance monitoring, tracing problems, and optimization are part of the things you have done in the past
  • We run our services on Amazon Web Services (AWS) and monitor them with New Relic and Kibana. Knowledge with those technologies is a plus, but not mandatory.
  • You are able to communicate verbally and written in English (we communicate mostly in English).

Benefits

  • Choose your own hardware
  • Working with newest technologies & microservices
  • Be part of an interdisciplinary team of experts
  • Working on products with a high impact on society
  • International teams
  • Flexible working hours
  • Free breakfast, good coffee & fresh fruits
  • Monthly mobility budget

If this caught your attention, then we can not wait to meet you soon! Just click this link.

Yours,

Anton, Ben, Bernd, Delia, Mark, Ulf, Patrick and Philip

If you have any questions or are in need for further information feel free to contact Mrs. Nicole Armatowski +49 176 3095 3172

title: Front-End Developer
description:
Job Description

Blackbox is looking for a strong front-end developer to join our UK dev team, to help build the next generation of information control systems for the rail industry.

You’ll initially be working alongside our front-end and back-end teams, planning and implementing features within our main UI application

We don’t have a large team, and we aren’t looking for someone to be anonymous. Passion and opinions count and will be welcomed. In return you’ll be a whole lot closer to the decision making, and in the sort of environment where people and careers grow quickly.

Salary £50,000 - £55,000

Things you'll need

  • Strong HTML, CSS (Sass), and Javascript skills
  • Extensive experience working with MVVM frameworks such as Aurelia or Angular
  • Experience working within Single Page Applications
  • A real passion for good quality, well-structured, clean code
  • Proficiency in building and maintaining reusable web components
  • Working knowledge of various asynchronous data retrieval and operating methodologies (WebSockets, XMLHttpRequests, Promises, etc.)

Things we'd like you to have

  • Experience with Typescript
  • Working knowledge of task runners such as Gulp or Grunt
  • Familiarity with transpilation and bundling processes
  • Experience with Azure
  • Experience with Jira or DevOps

About Blackbox

We’re all about trying to improve the experience for people who travel by train, by improving how information about their journey is made available to them (online, on platform, on train, on social media). More like the experience you get when flying.

It’s a broad mix that covers control room applications, data acquisition and management, integration to rail industry systems, externally-facing APIs, digital signage and audio, mobile apps, and more. We live in Azure, our front-ends run on Aurelia, code in TypeScript, plan using DevOps Boards, and deploy using DevOps Pipelines. Our back-ends run on Service Fabric (though now migrating to AKS), and are developed in C#.

We are a fairly young, privately-owned company. But we’re making a big noise in the industry. That’s because we hire smart people, and we expect them to take our vision and run with it.

What it's like working here

All our non-dev people are in the UK along with most of our dev team, though we do have a small dev team in Canada. Our UK office is near Bracknell, but we’re pretty comfortable with home-working. We get together when we need to - sometimes a trip to the office is required for discussions, design meetings, etc. The rest of the time we live and breathe Slack.

Don’t expect to be spoon-fed. We’re involved in some sizable, exciting projects and we need people who are comfortable taking ownership of whatever they are doing. Good people earn respect very quickly here. It’s fast-paced, and we wouldn’t have it any other way!

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f/div)
description:
Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f/div)

Elinvar enables Asset & Wealth Managers to digitalize their business model. By combining cutting-edge technology and the regulatory expertise of a licensed financial portfolio manager we offer our partners a comprehensive range of services. The platform's flexibility enables the customized solution for each partner.

Working at Elinvar is like our platform: straightforward and focused on excellence. As a B2B2C provider, we work with portfolio managers who manage billions of Euros in assets under management and have accordingly high expectations of us. Our team of dedicated technology and financial experts work hard to jointly meet and exceed those expectations.

About the technical stack: the platform consists of dozens of microservices which are mainly based on Java 8. They communicate through Kafka and a GraphQL. Data is stored in PostgreSQL and Couchbase. The services are running in Docker containers on three AWS data centers in a high availability mode, managed by Kubernetes. The frontend is based on React.js. We are using GitLab for source control and continuous integration. The development process is based on Scrum with 2-week sprints.

Sounds interesting? We're now looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f/div) to join our team at Elinvar.

What will keep you challenged?

  • Extending our monitoring and alerting with a focus on business processes.
  • Assisting the integration of 3rd parties like custodians banks.
  • Constantly improving the security of the platform.
  • Working on the Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery process.
  • Enhancing our highly accessible platform while using the latest technologies like AWS, Kubernetes, Ansible, Docker, Prometheus, Couchbase and Kafka.

Why Elinvar?

  • Based in Berlin, Elinvar is the comprehensive, digital and customized solution for wealth managers.
  • Our partners manage billions and expect excellence. We empower employees to reshape finance and look for talented and dedicated people.
  • Our co-founders share tremendous industry expertise and together with the team are dedicated to ensuring Elinvar's long-term success.
  • We believe hard work and success deserve to be celebrated - both in and out of the office.

Requirements

  • University degree or an equivalent education.
  • Experience with configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef or Puppet.
  • Experience with Linux and scripting languages like BASH, Python.
  • Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, AWS is a plus.
  • Fluent in English.
  • You advocate DevOps philosophy and emphasize effective communication and collaboration between engineering, product, and operations.
  • You never stop learning and are particularly passionate about technology.

Are you up for the challenge? Apply now via 'How to apply'.

Agency calls are not appreciated.
